entry.description: "TRANCHE KEY: ZEb8WJQd75/i4/POlusCyfWI7czMK+UT3kcIGy8P6caR3iYgUJdGR958BvUpwYS8v6Q56Pe1eiGKjK5H2Y8L/YG/A3kAAAAAAAAEDg== Gant-Branum, RL; Broussard, JA; Mahsut, A; Webb, DJ; McLean, JA. J. Proteome Res. 2009, submitted. Human embryonic kidney (HEK) cells were transfected with FLAG-GFP-APPL1. After 36 h, cells were then incubated with 1 mM peroxovanadate and 50 nM calyculin A for 30 minutes and extracted. The lysates were precleared twice with mouse IgG-agarose and immunoprecipitated with FLAG-agarose (Sigma, St. Louis, MO) for 2 h at 4 degrees C. Samples were washed and FLAG tagged APPL1 was eluted by incubation of the beads with 0.2 mg/ml FLAG peptide in 25 mM Tris for 30 min at 4 degrees C. For MS analyses, APPL1 was separated into three equal aliquots and proteolytically digested by trypsin, chymotrypsin, and Glu C proteases, respectively. Proteolysis was quenched by adding 1 ul of neat formic acid. Subsequently, the digest was lyophilized and then reconstituted in 25 ul 0.1% formic acid. LTQ trypsin sample."
